body_html: I think we'd be interested in adding an optional support for complex tensors. The best way would be to fork and work on the C libraries in torch/lib. This should be conflict-free with master, so you can do this for a long time. Once you get the libs to a usable state, you can start writing the bindings, and this is where we can provide some guidance on how to avoid conflicts at that time.
body_text: I think we'd be interested in adding an optional support for complex tensors. The best way would be to fork and work on the C libraries in torch/lib. This should be conflict-free with master, so you can do this for a long time. body: I think we'd be interested in adding an optional support for complex tensors. The best way would be to fork and work on the C libraries in `torch/lib`. This should be conflict-free with master, so you can do this for a long time. Once you get the libs to a usable state, you can start writing the bindings, and this is where we can provide some guidance on how to avoid conflicts at that time.
